job_title: Teaching Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Stellar institution and great place to learn & grow
cons: None– NYLS is a very supportive, uplifting, and cutting-edge employer

review_title: An institution that has potential but failing leaders
job_title: Financial Aid Counselor in New York, NY
pros: It is a beautiful building. The institution has some great staff members, and it is also centrally located to many subway stations. There are some offices that truly care about its students, and it is evident.
cons: An institution that continues to use you for your skillsets, takes everything from you, but you are not recognized for those contributions. The institution needs to revamp its leadership and the board should consider bringing in new leaders. This is from all the way from the top down. Rarely promotes from within, regardless of your contributions or record.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in New York, NY
pros: I make my own hours.
cons: it's good for being a student, but wish it was more.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: People care about their colleagues, good work-life balance, great location.
cons: Some staff and faculty have worked there for many years and stopped being innovative or driven. Budget is always an issue.

review_title: Great people and workplace but very low pay
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Super nice people, very easy, low pressure work.
cons: Extremely low pay for the area. Like "not a livable wage" low.

job_title: Director in New York, NY
pros: Caring and supportive community makes the school a great place to work
cons: None. There really are no cons

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: The people are great to work with
cons: The pay can be low

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Location, community, professors, advisors, and location again
cons: You are expected to be very independent in finding job opportunities and deadlines

job_title: Immigration Attorney in New York, NY
pros: committed to training and supporting law students and expansive work in immigration law
cons: an expensive city to live in

review_title: Great Second family/culture, poor institution practices
job_title: IT- Systems Administrative in New York, NY
pros: The perfect environment for a second family: Friendly, compassionate people with a good work and cultural ethic.  Enjoyable to go to work for, look forward to coming in everyday.  Great manager who is trusting and doesn't micro manage.  Team play is very strong.  Facilities are beautiful.
cons: Though the people are great, the institution as a whole is slowly crippling and is in a downward spiral financially.  Be cautious.  I'm told this is their second round of early severances and layoffs.  The 5 year projections were not good.  The way they handled the news left a bad taste in my mouth--short notice and not creative.  They always target Staff/Faculty before they downsize operation costs.  Be wary.  Top executives and financial team are inept at handling the budget.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Most professors are pretty flexible with hours you can work, and for an on-campus part time job the pay is pretty decent.
cons: They don't do direct deposit, and the payroll department only tells you there's a problem AFTER you come to pick up your check. Also there's a cap on the number of hours you can work per week, and they never make clear who's eligible for Federal Work Study and who's not, and why that's good or bad.

review_title: Bankrupt culture, demoralized staff, arrogant faculty, management that preaches but does not practice transparency.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Quirky, intelligent and compassionate co-workers, if you can find them. Decent benefits.  Occasionally driven and inspiring students.
cons: No professional development, zero upward mobility, demoralized staff, quickly diminishing benefits, culture of fear.

review_title: Amazing place to work, not just work... a family.
job_title: Student Attorney in New York, NY
pros: It really is a place where you become more than just the typical employee that does their day-to-day job, you become part of the family and are accepted and loved by everyone.
cons: Sometimes it is difficult to get to the building from certain areas, such as the lower east side.  However, because of its location in tribeca, it is worth it.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: academic environment is not stiff and "corporate". high level of activity with energized students. great location. benefits reduced but still great.
cons: downsizing, morale is poor. communication from senior admin is sketchy. management is very uneven and managers are untrained and inexpert. new leadership highly political, dishonorable in many ways. layoffs are likely.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Peaceful and quiet. Able to work on school work.
cons: Working late night shift if you're not a student. responsibility keeps on increasing while the pay doesn't.

job_title: in New York, NY
pros: Room for growth; great benefits
cons: A little top-heavy w/ executive leadership; declining enrollment (this is a nationwide issue, not just NYLS) led to frozen wages

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: NYLS is flexible with time.  You can adjust your hours to fit your life. They have a casual dress policy.  The employees are helpful and friendly.
cons: They don't pay well.

review_title: Where I learned how NOT to be a manager.
job_title: Development in New York, NY
pros: Great benefits -- lots of vacation time and holidays, good health insurance.
cons: Total unrest wih installation of new administration in 2012. Lots of politics, incompetant and sometimes abusive senior management. Human Resources is well aware of personnel issues and does not address them.

job_title: Student Ambassador in New York, NY
pros: Allows for a leadership role in the school as a student
cons: Have to be openly available for last minute tours of the school

job_title: Graduate Research Fellow in New York, NY
pros: Nice People to work with here.
cons: No job security, low pay
